q: the official Google blog, Eric Schmidt said Page will lead product development and technology strategy- his greatest strengths- and starting from April 4 will be in charge of Google's day-to-day operations as the CEO. I am enormously proud of my last decade as CEO, and I am certain that the next 10 years under Larry will be even better! Larry, in my clear opinion, is ready to lead, Eric Schmidt wrote. So when the change was announced by Eric Schmidt along with the buoyant 4 th quarter results of Google followed by a couple of say it all quips on twitter like Day to day adult supervision no longer needed it was obvious that this change was different, an overnight decision by the co-founders. It's time for him to have a shot at running this. Eric Schmidt , 55, who joined the company in 2001, will focus on deals, partnerships and customers, he wrote in a blog post. deal as weakening Italy's system of national contracts, but other unions backed it as encouraging investment. The bitter campaign split Italy's powerful labor unions. Industry Minister Maurizio Sacconi hailed the victory. The outcome of the referendum opens an evolution in industrial relations, especially in large factories that should allow a better use of the plants and a real increase in salaries, Maurizio Sacconi told Italian state radio. Sergio Marchionne had pledged to link pay increases to productivity. But the flexible work rules also limit the right to strike during full production, and reduce break times and sick pay

Simon Cowell is apparently planning to unveil his US line-up as early as next week, and if he take Cheryl Cole and Dermot with him, it will cause major headaches for ITV. A show source said: ITV is pulling out all the stops to ensure Simon Cowell can do both shows, but he still hasn't agreed anything, which is frustrating. If Cheryl Cole and Dermot also have to travel back and forth it could be tricky. The last thing they want is for any of them to pull out.

At the end of the interview, Nancy O'Dell lightened up the mood and asked Simon Cowell to let America in on three things no one knows about him. He responded: "I like ugly dogs." I like cartoons every morning, like the Flintstones and The Jetsons. "I like to climb trees." . Additional secret documents from his years at the Pentagon will be declassified and reviewed for public release, he said.
